Posts.Content: dlm217 wrote: I was diagnosed with BC in September.  Had surgery in November, have TE in, and have 1 more chemo left.  I will have my exchange surgery in May and 6 weeks of radiation probably starting in June.  For the most part mentally I have been better than I thought I would.  I was home from November until mid February.  Came back to work full time 2/21 right before starting Taxol.  I really haven't thought about not surviving this but lately I have been a crying mess when in the shower or alone.  Should I be more scared that I have stage IIIa BC? I am more upset about how I look and that I feel like no one gets what I am going through.  Sorry for all the rambling.  Dx 9/26/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 2, 7/26 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stage IIIa and struggling dlm217 Josiekat

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2012 11:42AM dlm217 wrote: Thanks everyone.  I think it may be the Taxol. I didn't feel as down on A/C as I do on the Taxol.  Thankfully tomorrow should be my last Taxol.
Posts.Title: Stage IIIa and struggling dlm217 Josiekat

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 07:24AM dlm217 wrote: I am sorry there are so many of us going through this.  It does make me feel better to know that someone out there understands how I feel and get its.  It is so hard that the people around you just don't get it and never will because I am the one living it.
Posts.Title: Stage IIIa and struggling dlm217 Josiekat

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2012 01:04PM dlm217 wrote: Thanks Ladies. I think I was in denial for awhile.  I still don't sit around thinking I am going to die.  It is more of an emotional thing about how I look which I know sounds vain but I just feel like I have lost myself.  The whole BMX, TE, the scars, the bald head, the weight gain.  People keep telling how strong and great I am handling and don't seem to want to hear when I do just want to vent or complain about what I am going through.  I feel like I have no release.  My husband has been great but he just doesn't get it.  We have so much going on right now.  I just turned 40 in February.  We have 3 sons, 14, 8 and 3.  I went back to work full time 2/21 in the middle of chemo and my husband was put on disability on 2/15.  He is scheduled for a hip replacement on Wednesday, 3/28/12.  I am not sure how things are going to work out the next couple of weeks.  I am just taking it one day at a time and trying to make th most of each day.
Posts.Title: Stage IIIa and struggling dlm217 Josiekat

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2012 08:21AM dlm217 wrote: I finished rads on 7/19.  I feel so lost.  I just can't get over this feeling that it will come back. I am 40 was 39 at diagnosis and have 3 sons (15, 8, and 3)  I can't stop thinking that I won't get to see them grow up.  I put on a brave face every day and go to work, do things with family and friends.  I haven't said anything to anyone about how I feel.  Thanks for the postive words. I hope I can stop dreading this soon.  I can't sleep some nights because I can't get it out of my mind.
Posts.Title: Does the looming dread of recurrence ever go away? lanagraves fondak

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 08:05AM dlm217 wrote: Thanks ICan.  I will go in with an open mind.  When this started the first dr. I saw initially was thinking stage 0 or 1.  I then had a 2nd and 3rd opinion.  I went with the 3rd dr. and things went fast from there.  So the stage IIIa diagnosis was a shock.  I never gave a 2nd thought to the treatment plan they layed out for me after surgery until now. They said since it's stage III we are going to throw everything we can at this to fight it and I was all for it.  I was reading on here some of the side effects people are having and have been down lately with the way I feel and look.  The whole mx, te, weight gain, no hair, looking and feeling liked I aged 10 years over night.  The thought of more of that for the next 5 years suddenly seemed overwhelming.

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 10:43PM dlm217 wrote: Thanks for the advice Pfitz1130.  I didn't realize I would have ice packs on after wards.  This has been the longest 2 weeks waiting for this biopsy.

Posts.Content: dlm217 wrote: I finished chemo a week ago today.  I am waiting for the MO office to call and schedule an appointment for me to discuss hormone therapy and start it.  I thought I was going to start this after my exchange surgery and radiation.  Is this something that every stage III with ER and/or PR + needs to take?  I just finished chemo.  I am still dealing with the side effects from that and am not looking forward to a pill for 5 years that will have side effects.  Anyone not take it? Posts.Title: Tamoxifen dlm217 sweetbean

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 09:56AM dlm217 wrote: Hi, I've been following this while going through chemo.  Today is 1 week since my last chemo.  I have  had the white peach fuzz for about 2 weeks now and it seems to have stopped growing.  How long did you ladies have the white fuzz?  I still have most of my eyebrows and eyelashes.  I have been filling my lashes in since I have a bald patch in each.  the lashes seem to be thinning.  Dr. told me last week at last chemo that they will probably start to fall out now.  I can't wait for my hair to grow.  I hate wearing a wig. All of you ladies look great.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 03:04PM dlm217 wrote: I had the biopsy on Tuesday.  They wound up doing an ultrasound guided biopsy instead of the stereotactic biopsy. This dr. did an ultrasound first and said she was able to see it on the ultrasound even though the other 2 doctors couldn't.  She took 4 samples.  She said she didn't see a mass.  She said what I am feeling is the ducts filled with calcifications.  She said I am most likely looking at surgery and an MRI next.  I should have the results by Friday.  She was nice but straight.  She was shocked that I felt it and brought it to my dr.'s attention.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Biopsy-Nervous dlm217 bonbondidit4

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2011 04:25PM dlm217 wrote: Hi pfitz, My dr. called on Thursday and told me it was cancer.  That is all she said at that point.  She didn't have all the results in. So said they had found cancer cells and precancer cells. She sent me for an MRI on Saturday and I have an appointment with her tomorrow at 1:45 to find out all the results and to see what treatment is recommended.  Thanks for asking.

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2011 08:44PM dlm217 wrote: Thank you for the replies.  I am starting to think it will not be the news I am hoping for.  I now have noticed my nipple is starting to invert and it is sore/tender.  I thought the tenderness was due to pms but not sure.  I will just have to wait for the biopsy/results and try not to drive myself crazy in the mean time.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Biopsy-Nervous dlm217 bonbondidit4

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2011 10:49AM dlm217 wrote: I'm in a similar situation right now.  I felt something and went to my dr.  They didn't see anything on the ultrasound but found a band of calcifications in my left breast.  I have seen a surgeon and have an appointment for 9/20 for a stereotactic biopsy.  I'm pretty stressed and scared.  My report had a BI-RADS 5 which everything I read online says is 95% cancer.  I hope you get benign result on your biopsy.
Posts.Title: Clustered Breast Calcification, Anyone deal with this? jlw23 VSM

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2011 12:36PM dlm217 wrote: jlw23 I'm not sure if they typically tell you or not.  I had to pick up my films and report to bring to the surgeon and of course I looked at the report.  It said BI-RADS 5 and I googled it.  The surgeon did say the radiologist was correct in giving it a BI-RADs 5 but didn't offer any further information. Glad you got it moved up.  I hope you get good news.

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2011 06:17AM dlm217 wrote: Hi, I met with the MO on Friday.  I will be starting chemo on 12/28.  Waiting to hear when my port placement, scan and test to check my heart are scheduled for. Not looking forward to any of this.  I am scheduled to go back to work 1/9/11 but will see how it goes after the first treatment. I am 39 and am also constantly being told how young I am.  So weird, I have a 2 year old and just a couple of years ago when I went to the ob it was marked as advanced maternal age and now I'm so young.
